pullRequest.body:
We define a class `CountableCategory`Â analogous to `FinCategory`, and provide some API for countable limits. This will be necessary to develop the theory of light condensed sets.

Instead of `SmallCategory`, cannot we allow any universe here?
I think these can also be `[Category Î±]` as well?
same
same
I think you would need to shrink the universes of the arrows as well?

I was just copying the `FinCategory`Â file here, I'm not using this for anything. 
But indeed it is also equivalent to a category with both objects and morphisms in `Type`. I don't need that fact either.
Ok I used this to do the universe polymorphic version of `HasCountableLimits.out`Â that you asked for. But I didn't need to shrink the universes of the arrows.
Is the `@` necessary? I thought lean would automatically infer that.
Also does `:= by infer_instance` work?

It works without the `@`, again I was just copying the `FinCategory`Â API. 
`:= by infer_instance` doesn't give an error but it doesn't find the instance either.
There should be a universe-polymorphic version of `HasCountableLimits.out` using `CountableCategory .objAsTypeEquiv`

```suggestion
universe v in
instance [Category.{v} J] [CountableCategory J] [HasCountableColimits C] : HasColimitsOfShape J C :=
```
This is not acutally universe polymorphic. The proof fails if you specify the universe.
Ah, I see! I'll fix that in a bit
Now it works, sorry it took so long

```suggestion
instance : SmallCategory (HomAsType Î±) := ShrinkHoms.instCategoryShrinkHoms.{0} _
```
just to be sure
